definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: My baby one month of the BCG , has not been review.
sentences.chinese: 我的孩子滿月時種的卡介苗，一直沒有進行復查。

sentences.english: The standard vaccination against tuberculosis is the BCG.
sentences.chinese: 標準的結核病疫苗是卡介苗。

sentences.english: Conclusion The effect of neonatal BCG vaccination is good in Baoji.
sentences.chinese: 結論寶雞市新生兒卡介苗接種效果良好。

sentences.english: The BCG vaccine boosts the TH1 response, but does not dampen the TH2 one.
sentences.chinese: 卡介苗促進了TH1的反應，但是不會削弱TH2。

sentences.english: The standard BCG vaccine is used worldwide against tuberculosis.
sentences.chinese: 標準的卡介苗在世界各國用來對付肺結核。

sentences.english: BCG, or bacillus Calmette-Guérin, is a vaccine for tuberculosis disease.
sentences.chinese: 卡介苗是用以預防結核病的一種疫苗。

sentences.english: After the operation, mitomycin and BCG were used for the Irrigation of bladder.
sentences.chinese: 術後採用絲裂黴素及卡介苗膀胱灌注。

sentences.english: The BCG library, if you are using it, without needing any change.
sentences.chinese: 卡介苗庫，如果您使用它，而不需要任何改變。

sentences.english: The effect of BCG against XDR-TB would therefore likely be very limited.
sentences.chinese: 因此，卡介苗對廣泛耐藥結核的作用可能非常有限。
